name: catachresis
text:
I was so scared the first time I saw this.
"Don't be scared Joe, Onstad won't kill Philippe. It's alright. He obviously wouldn't kill Philippe. Obviously. There's no way. No way.
Right?"

name: hollis
text: Me too...

name: tellumo
text: meeee toooo.

name: _cheesekayke
text:
I thought he might die at first, because it has been well-established that death in Achewood-universe is a lot like death in soap-opera-universe: Merely an opportunity to meet chicks.
But then I decided it would be too tragic and horrifying to do anyway.

name: wulvaine
text:
Of course Onstad wouldn't kill Philippe.

Nice Pete, on the other hand, had me worried when I first read this arc.

name: wolfslice
text: There is a deeply buried sarcasam at work here, it's very difficult to explain WHY this is funny, yet... it is.

name: mercuri0us
text: Maybe it's because Phillipe is still dressed as a bee.

name: centipede_damascus
text: DROP DROP DRIP

name: shinkusan
text: is SO atmospheric. This strip is scary.

name: relaxing
text: Despite the nervous situation, I find the image of Philippe hopping out the van without the use of his arms strangely satisfying.  The way he balances himself as his heeled shooes hit the ground.

name: heccibiggs
text: shoooooes

name: relaxing
text: shooes.

name: cdl146
text: This strip is art ! The wide first panel, onomatopoeia, and rain just set the mood perfectly. You don't get this with Garfield, people.

name: cleave
text: Onomatopoeia is one of the best yet subtlest things about Achewood.  The phone dialing is brilliant.  My favorite is "Beep Bop Dweedle Doop"

name: philosophe
text: ARBLE GABBLE GOBBLE GREEBLE

name: thatskotkid
text: SPLUT

name: gormster
text: puff

name: godfatherofsouls
text: sniff snaff snoof

name: heyman
text: pouf

name: salo
text: bruk

name: blahhhhhhh
text: ching chong wing wong?

name: snowman
text:
SLAP

DAP

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Wark

name: hellofditties
text: KOODGE!

name: the_voice
text:
mmmurrrgh...

EROGHREE-VAGH-GUH-GUH GUH!

ah-groobah-phuh!

UMURRRGH!

AWARRRGH!

WHANK!

KRAK

name: mr_lostman28
text: did.... did you just have sex?

name: mugi
text: A BLOO BLA BLOO BLOO BLOOOO! BLOO BLOOOO! A BLOO BLA BLOOO!

name: lexsenthur
text: You have your answer, mr_lostman28.

name: griffypoo
text:
Ahem.

*flup*

name: lawbot
text: Yes. I don't understand why it is so relatively low rated.

name: wae
text: "all I can say is that my life is pretty plain"

name: jyuu
text: The first panel is beautiful, if somewhat frightening as well.

name: blackblackred
text: Did anyone else notice that the road and walkway look like a cobra slinking along the ground?

name: foxtrotamend
text: Every time Philippe chooses a new outfit he gets exponentially cuter.

name: rowboat
text: I think this was the first arc which I consistently gave ratings of 4 based solely on the art.

name: afronaut
text: This strip makes me cold

name: poodlelucy
text: aaahhhh it's so quiet from lack of speaking [panels 2-5], and all the environmental noises are too loud... the tension is REAL.

name: atypicaloracle
text: I love that last panel for reasons that are hard to describe.

name: puguglypress
text: I like the lines in his face when he lands, showing the tiny amount of pain the jump caused

name: duperando
text:
For some reason, this story arc doesn't scare me so much, because I know that Philippe must not die. He is too retarded, too innocent, too stupid-cute to get rid of.
Panel four is just freaking awkward/cute/funny. I love his fat body, tiny boots, weird expression, and the little "oof" he says.
